key_questions_answered.1. Who are the distinct types of users?: Collectors/Traders: Users who collect Spider-Man merchandise and want to trade items. Content Creators: Users who create and upload fan-made Spider-Man films. Community Members: Users who participate in discussions, browse content, and engage socially. Moderators: Users who review reports and maintain community standards.
key_questions_answered.2. What are the key goals, behaviors, or: Collectors/Traders: Share merchandise collections with photos and descriptions, find items to trade or acquire, organize collections into categories, build trading history and reputation, maintain wishlists of desired items. Content Creators: Upload and share fan-made Spider-Man films, organize videos into playlists, receive feedback through comments and ratings. Community Members: Discover new merchandise and fan films, participate in discussion forums, connect with other Spider-Man fans, like and comment on content. Moderators: Review reported content, enforce community guidelines, maintain safe and friendly environment.
key_questions_answered.3. Who are the primary users or stakehol: Spider-Man fans and collectors (primary users), Fan film creators, Trading community members, Platform administrators/moderators
key_questions_answered.4. What is the first thing users will tr: Create a user account and profile, Upload photos of their Spider-Man merchandise collection, Browse existing merchandise posts and fan films
key_questions_answered.5. What problems, inefficiencies, or wor: Lack of a centralized platform for Spider-Man fans to connect, Difficulty finding trading partners for collectibles, No dedicated space for sharing fan-made Spider-Man content, Fragmented community across multiple platforms (eBay, forums, YouTube, etc.), No way to build reputation/trust for trading within the Spider-Man community
key_questions_answered.6. Where are users currently struggling,: Finding trustworthy trading partners (no reputation system), Organizing and sharing collections (no dedicated platform), Discovering fan films (scattered across video platforms), Building community connections (fragmented across platforms), Verifying authenticity of items (no community verification)
key_questions_answered.7. What other systems, data sources, or: Email service (for notifications and account verification), File storage/CDN (for images and video uploads), Video streaming service (for fan film playback), Payment processing (potentially for future selling features), Authentication/authorization system (for secure login), Search/indexing service (for content discovery)
key_questions_answered.8. What are the key behaviors or integra: User authentication system enables secure access to all features, File storage enables merchandise photo uploads and fan film hosting, Video streaming service enables playback of uploaded fan films, Email service enables notifications for trades, comments, and updates, Search/indexing enables discovery of merchandise, users, and videos, Notification system integrates with all features to alert users of activity
key_questions_answered.user_types:
1. Collectors - Users who collect Spider-Man merchandise (comics, action figures, posters, etc.) and want to showcase their collections
2. Traders - Users who want to trade collectibles with other fans
3. Content Creators - Users who create and upload fan-made Spider-Man films
4. Community Members - Users who want to discuss, share news, and connect with other fans
5. Moderators - Users who help maintain community standards and review reported content
key_questions_answered.key_goals:
1. Collectors: Showcase collections, organize items into collections, share photos with descriptions
2. Traders: Find trading partners, propose trades, negotiate deals, track trade history, build reputation
3. Content Creators: Upload fan films, organize playlists, get feedback through comments and ratings
4. Community Members: Discuss topics, share news, get collecting tips, upvote helpful content
5. Moderators: Review reported content, block problematic users, maintain community safety
key_questions_answered.primary_stakeholders: Spider-Man fans of all ages who are passionate about collecting, trading, creating content, or connecting with the community
key_questions_answered.first_user_action: Sign up and create a profile with their collection, favorite character, and bio. Then either: browse merchandise posts, search for items to trade, watch fan films, or participate in discussions
key_questions_answered.problems_eliminated:
1. No centralized place for Spider-Man fans to connect and share
2. Difficulty finding trading partners for collectibles
3. No platform to showcase fan-made Spider-Man content
4. Scattered discussions across multiple platforms
5. Lack of trust in trading (no rating/feedback system)
6. Difficulty organizing and cataloging collections
key_questions_answered.user_struggles:
1. Finding trustworthy trading partners
2. Discovering new collectibles and fan content
3. Organizing large collections
4. Getting visibility for their content/collections
5. Finding relevant discussions and community connections
key_questions_answered.external_systems:
1. Email service for notifications (optional)
2. Video hosting/CDN for fan film streaming
3. Image hosting/CDN for merchandise photos
4. Payment processing (future - if selling is added)
5. Authentication/identity provider (for secure login)
key_questions_answered.integration_points: Integration Point 1: Account creation → Profile building (user must have account before profile). Integration Point 2: Profile completion → Search results (user profile may appear in search results). Integration Point 3: Search → Browse (both discovery methods, can share underlying data).
key_questions_answered.1. Which areas of the story map carry th: Trading system: complex negotiation flow, trust/reputation, potential disputes. Video upload/streaming: technical complexity, storage/CDN, processing. User authentication/security: account security, data protection.
key_questions_answered.2. Which areas are expected to deliver t: User accounts and profiles: foundation for all features. Merchandise sharing: core value, enables trading. Basic trading system: differentiates the platform. Search functionality: enables discovery and engagement.
key_questions_answered.3. Which areas are the most complex or h: Trading negotiation system: complex workflows, high value. Video upload/streaming: high technical complexity, moderate immediate value. Notification system: integration complexity, moderate value.
key_questions_answered.4. Do you want thin slices to be as end-: Yes - each increment should deliver a complete user journey (e.g., sign up → create profile → upload merchandise → view it)
key_questions_answered.5. Are there any components, capabilitie: User authentication/authorization: used across all features. File/image storage/CDN: merchandise photos, profile pictures, video thumbnails. Email service: notifications, account verification. Video storage/streaming: fan films. Search/indexing: merchandise, users, videos, forum posts.
key_questions_answered.6. Are there any project or program cons: Phase 1 must launch first (per requirements): User accounts, Merchandise sharing, Basic trading, Fan movies, Search. Phase 2 follows: Forums, Advanced search, Notifications, Rating system. Phase 3 later: Mobile app, Events, Price guide, Badges.
key_questions_answered.7. Are there users or groups that must g: All users need accounts first (foundation). Collectors/Traders need merchandise sharing before trading. Content Creators need video upload before Community Members can watch. Moderators need basic content before moderation tools.
key_questions_answered.structured_content_ready: Yes - structured.json exists with complete story graph including epics, features, stories, and increments from prioritization phase
key_questions_answered.increment_scope: Foundation & Discovery (Priority: NOW, Size: Medium). Features: Create User Account (~5 stories), Build User Profile (~6 stories), Search Content (~5 stories), Browse by Category (~4 stories). Total: ~20 stories. Approach: Delivering End-to-End Journey. Purpose: Enables all other features, validates user interest.
key_questions_answered.major_workflows: User Registration & Onboarding: Sign up → Create account → Build profile. Content Discovery: Search for content → Browse by category → View results. User Identity Management: Account creation → Profile customization → Basic profile viewing.
key_questions_answered.systems_teams_roles: User Types: Collectors, Traders, Content Creators, Community Members, Moderators (all need accounts). Systems: Authentication/authorization system, User profile database, Search/indexing service, File storage/CDN (profile pictures).
key_questions_answered.story_groupings: Capability 1: User Account Management (Create + Profile). Capability 2: Content Discovery (Search + Browse).
key_questions_answered.story_sequence: Account creation must come first (foundation). Then: Profile building (enhances account). Parallel: Search and browse can be developed alongside profile features (independent discovery features).
key_questions_answered.dependencies: Create User Account must be completed before Build User Profile. Both account features should be completed before Search can show user profiles in results. Search Content and Browse by Category can be developed in parallel.
key_questions_answered.1. Which increment are we exploring?: Foundation & Discovery (Priority: NOW, Size: Medium) - The first increment that enables all other features and validates user interest.
key_questions_answered.2. What is the overarching outcome or us: Enable users to create accounts, build profiles, and discover content. Delivers complete user journey from sign-up to discovery, enabling all other features and validating user interest.
key_questions_answered.3. What is the first thing the user will: Sign up with email → verify email → create basic profile → search/browse content
key_questions_answered.4. What system reactions are expected fo: Account creation: validate email/password → create account → send verification email. Email verification: verify token → activate account. Profile creation: validate username/bio → save profile → display profile page. Search: query across merchandise/users/videos → return grouped results. Browse: load category → display paginated content → allow sorting.
key_questions_answered.5. Are we capturing both behavioral (use: Yes - Behavioral AC: user actions and system responses (When/Then format). Domain AC: concepts, behaviors, and rules aggregated at increment level.
key_questions_answered.6. Where do we 'pass the ball' between t: Sign-up form submission → account creation → email verification. Profile form submission → profile save → profile display. Search query → search execution → results display. Category selection → content loading → content display.
key_questions_answered.7. What are the likely unknowns, edge ca: Email service integration and failure handling, Password strength validation rules, Username uniqueness and validation, Search indexing and performance, File upload validation (profile pictures), Category organization and pagination
key_questions_answered.8. Are there domain rules or constraints: Email addresses must be unique, Usernames must be unique, Passwords must meet strength requirements, Profile pictures must meet format/size constraints, Search must handle empty results gracefully
key_questions_answered.9. Do we need to split or merge stories: Stories are already at appropriate granularity (user-system interaction level). Each story should have 3-7 behavioral AC based on complexity.
key_questions_answered.10. Is this increment too large? Should: No - 20 stories is manageable for exploration. The increment delivers a complete end-to-end journey.
key_questions_answered.11. What is the right amount of acceptan: Simple stories (Log Out, View Profile): 2-3 AC. Medium stories (Sign Up, Log In, Search): 4-6 AC. Complex stories (Password Reset, Profile Upload): 5-7 AC
key_questions_answered.12. How will we walk through the first a: Start with "Sign Up with Email" story, review first AC with user, ensure When/Then format is clear, and confirm component interactions are explicit.
key_questions_answered.13. What parts of this increment are lik: Email service (verification, password reset), File storage/CDN (profile pictures), Authentication/authorization system, Search/indexing service, Database (user accounts, profiles)
key_questions_answered.14. Where might technical uncertainty or: Email service integration (verification flow), File upload/validation (profile pictures), Search implementation (indexing, performance)

evidence_provided.Product Requirements Document: spider_man_fan/requirements.md - Comprehensive requirements document covering features, technical specifications, user experience goals, and launch priorities
evidence_provided.requirements_document: Complete requirements document provided at spider_man_fan/requirements.md covering all features, technical requirements, user experience goals, and launch priorities
evidence_provided.similar_systems:
The system combines elements of:
- eBay (trading/rating system)
- Instagram/Pinterest (photo sharing, collections)
- YouTube (video upload, playlists, comments)
- Reddit (forums, upvote/downvote, moderation)
- Social networks (profiles, following, notifications)
evidence_provided.Story map from Shape stage: Complete story map with 7 epics, 25 features, and 20 enumerated stories for Foundation & Discovery increment. Located at spider_man_fan/docs/stories/structured.json and spider_man_fan/docs/stories/map/spider-man-fan-community-story-map.md
evidence_provided.Business cases or initiative briefs: Product Requirements Document (spider_man_fan/requirements.md) specifies Phase 1 launch priorities: User accounts, Merchandise sharing, Basic trading, Fan movies, Search
evidence_provided.Project charters and delivery timelines: Requirements document defines three phases: Phase 1 (Must Have for Launch), Phase 2 (Add Soon After), Phase 3 (Future Enhancements)
evidence_provided.story_map: Available in structured.json with 7 epics, 25 features
evidence_provided.user_types: Defined in clarification.json (Collectors, Traders, Content Creators, Community Members, Moderators)
evidence_provided.Discovery refinements from Discovery sta: All 20 stories for Foundation & Discovery increment enumerated with component interaction descriptions. Stories follow user-system interaction granularity. Located in structured.json and increments markdown.
evidence_provided.Planning decisions: Planning decisions specify behavioral AC level (not domain AC) for exploration phase. Stories should have 3-7 AC based on complexity. Located at spider_man_fan/docs/activity/story_bot/planning.json
evidence_provided.User types and goals: Defined in clarification.json: Collectors, Traders, Content Creators, Community Members, Moderators. All need accounts and profiles.
evidence_provided.Requirements document: Product Requirements Document at spider_man_fan/requirements.md with technical specifications for email service, file storage, authentication, and search
evidence_provided.Increment details: Foundation & Discovery increment includes: Create User Account (5 stories), Build User Profile (6 stories), Search Content (5 stories), Browse by Category (4 stories). Total: 20 stories.

additional_questions_answered.scope_level: End-to-end user-system behavior - One user interaction followed by one system response
additional_questions_answered.drill_down_areas: Focus on highest value areas (Phase 1 features: user accounts, merchandise sharing, trading, fan films, search) with deeper exploration of user workflows for trading system and content organization
additional_questions_answered.story_breakdown: Create User Account: 5 stories, Build User Profile: 6 stories, Search Content: 5 stories, Browse by Category: 4 stories
additional_questions_answered.ac_approach: Behavioral AC in When/Then format for all stories. Domain AC aggregated at increment level.
additional_questions_answered.integration_points: Email service, File storage/CDN, Authentication system, Search/indexing service, Database
